Transcript: [Written on The Dodge Hotel stationery]  [October 10, 1934] Wednesday Night  My dearest:  Tonight I’m a sick little man. Am going to bed without looking at a law book. The flu hit me today and if I don’t feel better in the morning I won’t go to the office.  I wish you were here to nurse me--but you aren’t.  Goodnight Honey--  Lyndon   [Envelope postmarked: Washington, D.C., 10/10/1934, 12 PM]   [Transcript prepared by LBJ Library staff, January 2013]
Title: Letter, Lyndon Johnson to Lady Bird Taylor, October 10, 1934
Creator: Lyndon Baines Johnson
Abstract: LBJ writes that he has the flu and wishes Lady Bird were there to nurse him.
Collection: The Personal Papers of Lyndon and Lady Bird Johnson are a collection of correspondence between Lyndon and Lady Bird Johnson that spans 1934 through 1968. During the Johnsons’ years in the White House, Dorothy Territo, a staff assistant who maintained files of high historical value, as well as family and genealogical material, had custody of the collection. In 1969, the files she kept came to Austin as part of President Johnson’s papers, which he had deeded to the U.S. government in August 1965.This collection includes the courtship letters between Lyndon Johnson and Claudia "Lady Bird" Taylor, from the period between their introduction and their marriage, September – November 1934.
Citation: “Letter, Lyndon Johnson to Lady Bird Taylor, October 10, 1934,” Personal Papers of Lyndon B. and Lady Bird Johnson, LBJ Presidential Library, Dear Bird: The 1934 Courtship Letters , accessed November 27, 2016, http://archives.lbjlibrary.org/items/show/405.
